section.title: Preparing Optical Hypervisor Installation Media
section.para: Burn the hypervisor image to a CD-ROM with the wodim command. The wodim command is part of the wodim package.

step.para: Verify that the wodim package is installed on the system.
If the package version is in the output the package is available.
If nothing is listed, install wodim:
Insert a blank CD-ROM or DVD into your CD or DVD writer.
Record the ISO file to the disc. The wodim command uses the following:
This example uses the first CD-RW (/dev/cdrw) device available and the default hypervisor image location, /usr/share/rhev-hypervisor/rhev-hypervisor.iso.

section.para: If no errors occurred, the hypervisor is ready to boot. Errors sometimes occur during the recording process due to errors on the media itself. If this occurs insert another writable disk and repeat the command above.

The hypervisor uses a program (isomd5sum) to verify the integrity of the installation media every time the hypervisor is booted. If media errors are reported in the boot sequence you have a bad CD-ROM. Follow the procedure above to create a new CD-ROM or DVD.
